summary: the study Our twin objectives were to promote coordinated implementation of quarantine measures by the several local military and civilian agencies and jurisdictions in San Diego County. the exercise referred to restriction at home of possible carriers of the agent, who were identified through contact tracing. civilian law enforcement officials characterized the public health crisis in the exercise scenario as "unprecedented" they often expressed concerns about carrying out enforcement measures requested by civilian public health authorities. no program or funds to compensate for income lost by still-healthy contacts while in quarantine existed at the local, state, or federal level. planning for quarantine must be based on collaborative command and control, best articulated in MOA or MOU. early collaboration of nonmedical officials in exercise planning should be obtained. a fourth lesson is to use exercises to help develop quarantine plans. capacity and pinpoint deficiencies in interagency collaboration.
